questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
Kf for water is 1.86K kg mol–1. If your automobile radiator holds 1.0 kg of water, how many grams of
ethylene glycol (C2H6O2) must you add to get the freezing point of the solution lowered to –2.8oC ?

questions.question_text:

1.15 g/mL. The molarity of this solution is :

option_texts.B: All amino acids are optically active

option_texts.D: All amino acids except glutamic acid are optically active

questions.question_text: Iron exhibits + 2 and +3 oxidation states. Which of the following statements about iron is incorrect?

option_texts.A: Ferrous oxide is more basic in nature than the ferric oxide
option_texts.B: Ferrous compounds are relatively more ionic than the corresponding ferric compounds
option_texts.C: Ferrous compounds are less volatile than the corresponding ferric compounds
option_texts.D: Ferrous compounds are more easily hydrolysed than the corresponding ferric compounds.

(b) n = 4, $$ l$$ = 0

(c) n = 3, $$l$$ = 2

Can be placed in order of increasing energy as :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: Let X = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5}. The number of different ordered pairs (Y, Z) that can be formed such that Y $$ \subseteq $$ X, Z $$ \subseteq $$ X and Y $$ \cap $$ Z is empty, is :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text:
Let x1, x2,........., xn be n observations, and let $$\overline x $$ be their arithematic mean and $${\sigma ^2}$$ be their variance.


Statement 1 : Variance of 2x1, 2x2,......., 2xn is 4$${\sigma ^2}$$.

Statement 2 : : Arithmetic mean of 2x1, 2x2,......, 2xn is 4$$\overline x $$.

option_texts.A: Statement 1 is false, statement 2 is true
option_texts.B: Statement 1 is true, statement 2 is true; statement 2 is a correct explanation for statement 1
option_texts.C: Statement 1 is true, statement 2 is true; statement 2 is not a correct explanation for statement 1
option_texts.D: Statement 1 is true, statement 2 is false

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text:
If $$f:R \to R$$ is a function defined by


$$f\left( x \right) = \left[ x \right]\cos \left( {{{2x - 1} \over 2}} \right)\pi $$,


where [x] denotes the greatest integer function, then $$f$$ is

option_texts.C: discontinuous only at non-zero integral values of $$x$$

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text:
Consider the function, $$f\left( x \right) = \left| {x - 2} \right| + \left| {x - 5} \right|,x \in R$$


Statement - 1 : $$f'\left( 4 \right) = 0$$


Statement - 2 : $$f$$ is continuous in [2, 5], differentiable in (2, 5) and $$f$$(2) = $$f$$(5)

option_texts.A: Statement - 1 is false, statement - 2 is true
option_texts.B: Statement - 1 is true, statement - 2 is true; statement - 2 is a correct explanation for statement - 1
option_texts.C: Statement - 1 is true, statement - 2 is true; statement - 2 is not a correct explanation for statement - 1
option_texts.D: Statement - 1 is true, statement - 2 is false

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text:
Let $$a,b \in R$$ be such that the function $$f$$ given by $$f\left( x \right) = In\left| x \right| + b{x^2} + ax,\,x \ne 0$$ has extreme values at $$x=-1$$ and $$x=2$$ 
Statement-1 : $$f$$ has local maximum at $$x=-1$$ and at $$x=2$$.

Statement-2 : $$a = {1 \over 2}$$ and $$b = {-1 \over 4}$$

option_texts.A: Statement - 1 is false, Statement - 2 is true.
option_texts.B: Statement - 1 is true , Statement - 2 is true; Statement - 2 is a correct explanation for Statement - 1.
option_texts.C: Statement - 1 is true, Statement - 2 is true; Statement - 2 is not a correct explanation for Statement - 1.
option_texts.D: Statement - 1 is true, Statement - 2 is false.

If a leak in the balloon causes the gas to escape at the rate of $$72\pi $$ cubic meters per minute, then the rate (in meters per minute) at which the radius of the balloon decreases $$49$$ minutes after the leakage began is :

If the centre of the ellipse is at the origin and its axes are the coordinate axes, then the equation of the ellipse is :

option_texts.D: a rational number other than positive integers

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: If $$z \ne 1$$ and $$\,{{{z^2}} \over {z - 1}}\,$$ is real, then the point represented by the complex number z lies :

option_texts.A: either on the real axis or a circle passing through the origin.
option_texts.B: on a circle with centre at the origin
option_texts.C: either on real axis or on a circle not passing through the origin.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: Let $$ABCD$$ be a parallelogram such that $$\overrightarrow {AB}  = \overrightarrow q ,\overrightarrow {AD}  = \overrightarrow p $$ and $$\angle BAD$$ be an acute angle. If $$\overrightarrow r $$ is the vector that coincide with the altitude directed from the vertex $$B$$ to the side $$AD,$$ then  $$\overrightarrow r $$ is given by :

option_texts.A: $$\overrightarrow r  = 3\overrightarrow q  - {{3\left( {\overrightarrow p .\overrightarrow q } \right)} \over {\left( {\overrightarrow p .\overrightarrow p } \right)}}\overrightarrow p $$
option_texts.B: $$\overrightarrow r  =  - \overrightarrow q  + {{\left( {\overrightarrow p .\overrightarrow q } \right)} \over {\left( {\overrightarrow p .\overrightarrow p } \right)}}\overrightarrow p $$
option_texts.C: $$\vec r = \vec q - {{\left( {\vec p.\vec q} \right)} \over {\left( {\vec p.\vec p} \right)}}\vec p$$
option_texts.D: $$\overrightarrow r  =  - 3\overrightarrow q  - {{3\left( {\overrightarrow p .\overrightarrow q } \right)} \over {\left( {\overrightarrow p .\overrightarrow p } \right)}}$$

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Assume that a neutron breaks into a proton and an electron.  The energy released during this process is : (mass of neutron $$ = 1.6725 \times {10^{ - 27}}kg,$$ mass of proton $$ = 1.6725 \times {10^{ - 27}}\,kg,$$ mass of electron $$ = 9 \times {10^{ - 31}}\,kg$$ ).

questions.question_text: An object $$2.4$$ $$m$$ in front of a lens forms a sharp image on a film $$12$$ $$cm$$ behind the lens.  A glass plate $$1$$ $$cm$$ thick, of refractive index $$1.50$$ is interposed between lens and film with its plane faces parallel to film. At what distance (from lens) should object shifted to be in sharp focus of film?

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: An electromagnetic wave in vacuum has the electric and magnetic field $$\mathop E\limits^ \to  $$and $$\mathop B\limits^ \to  $$, which are always perpendicular to each other. The direction of polarization is given by $$\mathop X\limits^ \to  $$ and that of wave propagation by $$\mathop k\limits^ \to  $$. Then

option_texts.A: $$\mathop X\limits^ \to  ||\mathop B\limits^ \to  $$ and $$\mathop X\limits^ \to  ||\mathop B\limits^ \to   \times \mathop E\limits^ \to  $$
option_texts.B: $$\mathop X\limits^ \to  ||\mathop E\limits^ \to  $$ and $$\mathop k\limits^ \to  ||\mathop E\limits^ \to   \times \mathop B\limits^ \to  $$
option_texts.C: $$\mathop X\limits^ \to  ||\mathop B\limits^ \to  $$ and $$\mathop k\limits^ \to  ||\mathop E\limits^ \to   \times \mathop B\limits^ \to  $$
option_texts.D: $$\mathop X\limits^ \to  ||\mathop E\limits^ \to  $$ and $$\mathop k\limits^ \to  ||\mathop B\limits^ \to   \times \mathop E\limits^ \to  $$

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: In Young's double slit experiment , one of the slit is wider than other, so that amplitude of the light from one slit is double of that from other slit. If $${{\rm I}_m}$$ be the maximum intensity, the resultant intensity $${\rm I}$$ when they interfere at phase difference $$\phi $$ is given by :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A coil is suspended in a uniform magnetic field, with the plane of the coil parallel to the magnetic lines of force. When a current is passed through the coil it starts oscillating; It is very difficult to stop. But if an aluminium plate is placed near to the coil, it stops. This is due to :

option_texts.A: development of air current when the plate is placed
option_texts.B: induction of electrical charge on the plate
option_texts.C: shielding of magnetic lines of force as aluminium is a para-magnetic material.
option_texts.D: electromagnetic induction in the aluminium plate giving rise to electromagnetic damping.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A charge $$Q$$ is uniformly distributed over the surface of non-conducting disc of radius $$R.$$ The disc rotates about an axis perpendicular to its plane and passing through its center with an angular velocity $$\omega .$$ As a result of this rotation a magnetic field of induction $$B$$ is obtained at the center of the disc. If we keep both the amount of charge placed on the disc and its angular velocity to be constant and very the radius of the disc then the variation of the magnetic induction at the center of the disc will be represented by the figure :

The radii of proton, denuteron and alpha particle are  respectively $${r_p},{r_d}$$ and $${r_\alpha }$$.  Which one of the following relation is correct?

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: The mass of a spaceship is $$1000$$ $$kg.$$ It is to be launched from the earth's surface out into free space. The value of $$g$$ and $$R$$ (radius of earth ) are $$10\,m/{s^2}$$ and $$6400$$ $$km$$ respectively. The required energy for this work will be:

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Two electric bulbs marked $$25W$$ $$-$$ $$220$$ $$V$$ and $$100W$$ $$-$$ $$220V$$ are connected in series to a $$440$$ $$V$$ supply. Which of the bulbs will fuse?

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
This question has statement- $$1$$ and statement- $$2.$$ Of the four choices given after the statements, choose the one that best describe the two statements.

An insulating solid sphere of radius $$R$$ has a uniformly positive charge density $$\rho $$. As a result of this uniform charge distribution there is a finite value of electric potential at the center of the sphere, at the surface of the sphere and also at a point out side the sphere. The electric potential at infinite is zero. 
Statement- $$1:$$ When a charge $$q$$ is take from the centre of the surface of the sphere its potential energy changes by $${{q\rho } \over {3{\varepsilon _0}}}$$ 

Statement- $$2:$$ The electric field at a distance $$r\left( {r < R} \right)$$ from the center of the sphere is $${{\rho r} \over {3{\varepsilon _0}}}.$$

option_texts.A: Statement- $$1$$ is true,  Statement- $$2$$ is true; Statement- $$2$$  is not the correct explanation of Statement- $$1$$.
option_texts.B: Statement $$1$$ is true, Statement $$2$$ is false.
option_texts.C: Statement $$1$$ is false,  Statement $$2$$ is true.
option_texts.D: Statement- $$1$$ is true,  Statement- $$2$$ is true; Statement- $$2$$  is the correct explanation of Statement- $$1$$.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: In a uniformly charged sphere of total charge $$Q$$ and radius $$R,$$ the electric field $$E$$ is plotted as function of distance from the center. The graph which would correspond to the above will be:

questions.question_text: A cylindrical tube, open at both ends, has a fundamental frequency, $$f,$$ in air. The tube is dipped vertically in water so that half of it is in water. The fundamental frequency of the air-column is now :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A wooden wheel of radius $$R$$ is made of two semicircular part (see figure). The two parts are held together by a ring made of a metal strip of cross sectional area $$S$$ and length $$L.$$ $$L$$ is slightly less than $$2\pi R.$$ To fit the ring on the wheel, it is heated so that its temperature rises by $$\Delta T$$ and it just steps over the wheel. As it cools down to surrounding temperature, it process the semicircular parts together. If the coefficient of linear expansion of the metal is $$\alpha $$, and its Young's modulus is $$Y,$$ the force that one part of the wheel applies on the other part is :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
This question has Statement $$1$$ and Statement $$2.$$ Of the four choices given after the Statements, choose the one that best describes the two Statements. 


If two springs $${S_1}$$ and $${S_2}$$ of force constants $${k_1}$$ and $${k_2}$$, respectively, are stretched by the same force, it is found that more work is done on spring $${S_1}$$ than on spring $${S_2}$$.


STATEMENT 1: If stretched by the same amount work done on $${S_1}$$, Work done on $${S_1}$$ is more than $${S_2}$$

STATEMENT 2: $${k_1} < {k_2}$$

option_texts.A: Statement 1 is false, Statement 2 is true
option_texts.B: Statement 1 is true, Statement 2 is false
option_texts.C: Statement 1 is true, Statement 2 is true, Statement 2 is the correct explanation for Statement 1
option_texts.D: Statement 1 is true, Statement 2 is true, Statement 2 is not the correct explanation for Statement 1

can throw the same stone up to will be

questions.question_text:
A spectrometer gives the following reading when used to measure the angle of a prism.

Main scale reading: 58.5 degree

Vernier scale reading : 09 divisions

Given that 1 division on main scale corresponds to 0.5 degree. Total divisions on the vernier scale is 30 and match with 29 divisions of the main scale. The angle of the prism from the above data

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
Resistance of a given wire is obtained by measuring the current flowing in it and the voltage difference
applied across it. If the percentage errors in the measurement of the current and the voltage difference
are 3% each, then error in the value of resistance of the wire is
